entries.author: Kristin Tate
entries.text: I was incredibly shocked to hear the news & send my deepest condolences to Blake´s family, work family & friends. I worked with Blake a few years now through our HOA / William Douglas. I am on the board for one of the communities Blake serviced so I worked with him on a number of jobs in our community & around my home. You wouldn´t meet a more genuine, honest, nice & hard working family man. It was a pleasure working with him. He always did great work for us. His presence here will be missed.

entries.author: Debra Dawson
entries.text: Victoria I am so sorry he is gone. I know how much you loved David. Thinking of you at this sad time, Debra D

entries.author: Karen Lette Fisher
entries.text:
Jo Ann, Tiffany, and David,

I was so sad to hear about Blake´s passing. He always held a special place in my heart. He was so lucky to have such a wonderful family. Keeping you all in my prayers. 

Karen Lette

entries.author: Betty Sprowles
entries.text: Blake was a good man always outside doing something. He loved his yard always outside, doing something with his beloved dog, Holly right by his side. He always asked if I was OK and if there was anything I needed to let him know, he will be greatly missed such a good neighbor!

entries.author: Tiffany Melton Smith
entries.text: I love you Blake! You have always been my hero. I have always looked up to my big brother. You will be so missed. I love you infinity

entries.author: Mike
entries.text:
Blake I met you 4 years ago and immediately felt like I knew you my whole life. 
You were someone who would sacrifice to make others happy for sure. Godspeed to you and your family during this difficult time.

embeddedEntries.author: Charlotte Observer
embeddedEntries.text: David Blake Melton June 16, 1970 - February 5, 2025 Charlotte, North Carolina - David Blake Melton of Charlotte passed away suddenly at home on February 5, 2025. He was born on June 16,1970. He attended Garinger HS. He is survived by his devoted and loving wife of 23 years Victoria Melton, his two boys Charles Melton and John Cantrell of Charlotte. His loving Mother Joeann Caudle, and his step father David Caudle. His younger sister Tiffany Melton Smith, her three children Tyler Lilly, Ryle Smith and Presley Smith. Blake was the owner of Sundance Irrigation. He loved all of his customers through the 8 years he owned the company. The many homeowners of the HOA's he took care of for William Douglas Management Company. He loved to be outdoors and had an amazing gift of a Green Thumb. He loved his work. Blake is preceded in death by his father's Bobby Lee Melton, and Bobby Brown both of Charlotte. His Brother Justin Brown and his Cherished Grandparents Dick and Libby Byers. He will be desperately missed by all who knew and loved him. Services will be held at McEwin Funeral Home on Monroe Rd on Feb 19, from 6-8 p.m. A funeral Mass at St Mathews Catholic Church on Rea Rd, will be held Feb 20, at 11:00 a.m. Please join us in celebrating Blake's life immediately after the church at Firethorns at Stonecrest Shopping center.

obituary.html: David Blake Melton<br /><br /> June 16, 1970 - February 5, 2025<br /><br /> Charlotte, North Carolina - David Blake Melton of Charlotte passed away suddenly at home on February 5, 2025. He was born on June 16,1970. He attended Garinger HS. He is survived by his devoted and loving wife of 23 years Victoria Melton, his two boys Charles Melton and John Cantrell of Charlotte. His loving Mother Joeann Caudle, and his step father David Caudle. His younger sister Tiffany Melton Smith, her three children Tyler Lilly, Ryle Smith and Presley Smith. Blake was the owner of Sundance Irrigation. He loved all of his customers through the 8 years he owned the company. The many homeowners of the HOA's he took care of for William Douglas Management Company. He loved to be outdoors and had an amazing gift of a Green Thumb. He loved his work. Blake is preceded in death by his father's Bobby Lee Melton, and Bobby Brown both of Charlotte. His Brother Justin Brown and his Cherished Grandparents Dick and Libby Byers. He will be desperately missed by all who knew and loved him. Services will be held at McEwin Funeral Home on Monroe Rd on Feb 19, from 6-8 p.m. A funeral Mass at St Mathews Catholic Church on Rea Rd, will be held Feb 20, at 11:00 a.m. Please join us in celebrating Blake's life immediately after the church at Firethorns at Stonecrest Shopping center.

newsArticleSchema.articleBody: David Blake Melton June 16, 1970 - February 5, 2025 Charlotte, North Carolina - David Blake Melton of Charlotte passed away suddenly at home on February 5, 2025. He was born on June 16,1970. He attended Garinger HS. He is survived by his devoted and loving wife of 23 years Victoria Melton, his two boys Charles Melton and John Cantrell of Charlotte. His loving Mother Joeann Caudle, and his step father David Caudle. His younger sister Tiffany Melton Smith, her three children Tyler Lilly, Ryle Smith and Presley Smith. Blake was the owner of Sundance Irrigation. He loved all of his customers through the 8 years he owned the company. The many homeowners of the HOA's he took care of for William Douglas Management Company. He loved to be outdoors and had an amazing gift of a Green Thumb. He loved his work. Blake is preceded in death by his father's Bobby Lee Melton, and Bobby Brown both of Charlotte. His Brother Justin Brown and his Cherished Grandparents Dick and Libby Byers. He will be desperately missed by all who knew and loved him. Services will be held at McEwin Funeral Home on Monroe Rd on Feb 19, from 6-8 p.m. A funeral Mass at St Mathews Catholic Church on Rea Rd, will be held Feb 20, at 11:00 a.m. Please join us in celebrating Blake's life immediately after the church at Firethorns at Stonecrest Shopping center.
